findings.title: OCTD - Transfers Contract's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to claim all the balance of the contract by calling the `manualSend` function.

findings.title: ZD - Zero Division
findings.description: The contract uses variables that may be set to zero as denominators, leading to unpredictable and potentially harmful results, such as a transaction revert.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide's naming conventions, which can negatively impact readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.

findings.title: L12 - Using Variables before Declaration
findings.description: The contract is using a variable before the declaration. This is usually happening either if it has not been declared yet or if the variable has been declared in a different scope.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.
